'Dioctyl sodium sulfosuccinate' or 'docusate sodium' (INN, ) â often referred to
as 'DSS', 'Aerosol OT' or 'AOT' â is a common ingredient in consumer products,
especially laxatives of the stool softener type. It is also used as an
emulsifying, wetting, and dispersing agent, as a pesticide, PAN
Pesticides Database:
[http://www.pesticideinfo.org/Detail_Chemical.jsp?Rec_Id=PC33310 Dioctyl sodium
sulfosuccinate] as well as a component of the oil dispersant Corexit which
was used in the ''Deepwater Horizon'' oil spill of 2010. It is an
anionic surfactant, a substance that lowers the surface tension of water.

'Docusate [[calcium]]' and 'docusate [[potassium]]', as well as other dioctyl
sulfosuccinate salts, are also widely used in the same areas.
